abstract: The first loss at Goldman Sachs since the financial crisis points to what could be a more lasting shift in the financial industry, which has been steadily retrenching.
snippet: The first loss at Goldman Sachs since the financial crisis points to what could be a more lasting shift in the financial industry, which has been steadily retrenching.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs, once Wall Street's highest flier, has been grounded, and it does not bode well for the rest of the financial industry or the New York City economy that depends on it.

headline.main: Goldman Loss Offers a Bad Omen for Wall Street
